item.title: Python exception handling and sys.exit magic
item.description: Some Python magic around sys.exit() function. Recently Iâ€™ve been at the interview for one big Israel startup. They asked me to read the code below and say what will be in the output. import sys def some_func(): ... def _child_process(target): try: target() sys.exit(0) except: print("Exception") sys.exit(1) finally: print("Out") try: _child_process(some_func) finally: print("Out2") What do you think to be the output after running this code snippet? Is it depend on the body of some_func function?
